body.p: “Catch a peeper at Hayden’s Pool. I suspect it may have been a female “,” for “,” though I kept it a day at home “,” it did not peep. It was a pale fawn-color out of water “,” nine tenths of an inch long “,” marked with dusky like this “,” though not so distinctly. It could easily climb up the side of a tumbler “,” and jumped eighteen inches at once.”
PE 13, pg. 370 / 25 November 1857-4 June 1858/ NNPM MA 1302:31 / T vol. # XXV / PDF # XVI / JX
